intro: Mikania obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forests. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it both a popular garden plant and a potential invasive species in some areas.
